message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NA, cs.SY. 

The paper deals with coding-theoretic ideas for mitigating the effect of stragglers in distributed matrix computations, which is a topic related to information theory and distributed computing. Therefore, cs.IT and cs.DC are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the numerical stability of the proposed method, which is related to numerical analysis and scientific computing, making cs.NA a likely sub-category as well. The use of circulant permutation matrices and rotation matrices is a topic related to algebra and discrete mathematics, which makes cs.DS a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a method for improving the conditioning of Vandermonde matrices, which is a topic related to control theory and systems engineering, making cs.SY a possible sub-category.
